title: Is the Hebrew king (Saul) described in the prophecy of Samuel actually such a bad example of governance? - Quora

response.answer_text: By Biblical standards, Shaul was disobedient and tried far too much to please his soldiers rather than following the directions of the prophet who sponsored him: Samuel. Shaul kept the Amaleqi king AGAG alive, and allowed his soldiers to keep property from the conquered tribe, which led to problems. By modern political standards, who knows?
